info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 10 at 5:52AM MST until October 10 at 8:45AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of east central, north central, and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in east central Arizona, Gila. In north central Arizona, Coconino. In west central Arizona, Yavapai.
* WHEN...Until 845 AM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick roads and muddy unpaved roads. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 550 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Professor Creek, Squaw Creek, Pigeon Creek, Middle Red Creek, Tangle Creek, East Branch Squaw Creek, Hardscrabble Creek, Red Creek, Bishop Creek, Brushy Creek, Toms Creek, Dry Wash, South Fork Mud Spring Creek, West Clear Creek, Wet Bottom Creek, Corduroy Wash, Bull Run Creek, West Webber Creek, Deadman Creek, Lime Creek, Fossil Creek, Verde River, Clover Creek, South Prong Sycamore Creek, Ash Spring Creek, New River, Davenport Wash, Spring Wash, Little Lime Creek, Mud Spring Creek, Cold Water Creek, Horse Creek, Houston Creek and Sycamore Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Childs Power Plant, Fossil Creek Day Use Area, Fossil Creek Waterfall, The Toilet Bowl, Strawberry, Table Mountain, Pine, Chalk Mountain, Sunset Mountain, Indian Maiden Falls, Hanging Garden, Pine Mountain Wilderness, Tonto Natural Bridge State Park, Cedar Bench Wilderness, Fossil Springs Wilderness and West Clear Creek Wilderness. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 233 and 251. State Route 87 between mile markers 267 and 280.
This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes and waterfalls on Fossil Creek and Fossil Creek Dam "The Toilet Bowl". - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM MST THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Coconino, AZ; Gila, AZ; Yavapai, AZ
